Articles.Content:
A next one!!!???!!! Your kerbal tailoring skills are remarkable sir, I salute you

I can / want / will do much better

I can / want / will do much better

Well, in that case I'll wait off getting it until the next one. Although the current model does look pretty cool. Not so much diverish as more like the golden army from the Hellboy movie .

Well, in that case I'll wait off getting it until the next one. Although the current model does look pretty cool. Not so much diverish as more like the golden army from the Hellboy movie .

you may be waiting for a while...
I'm not a fan of this art style but the parts still look pretty good.
Do those wings already have FAR values, or i have to add some in? I use FAR and i don't want to abandon use of those

Made a Hyperdrive in my AAR using your parts!

Yeah, It is very simple, and only functions because of hyperedit, but.... It looks cool.
cool, looks like the Comet of Captain future (the Effect)

Do those wings already have FAR values, or i have to add some in? I use FAR and i don't want to abandon use of those

I have not integrated FAR yet

I am adding the science instruments to the capsule internals and hopefully make them interactive

---edit---

well the parts are added to IVA view but I have yet to get them to show measurements/perform experiments etc....

Edited April 14, 2014 by Kerb-fu
new version again, minor fixes like the boiler and generator, some model streamlining and bug fixes etc version 0.15a
I have updated all my suit packs including the Steam Punk one so check out the updated version Green Skull Inc Custom Design Spacesuits v0-38

I have updated all my suit packs including the Steam Punk one so check out the updated version Green Skull Inc Custom Design Spacesuits v0-38

I cant wait to try it out!

When I'm playing with the parts, I keep thinking of H.G. Wells and the first Men in the Moon book and movie.

Do you think it might make for a fun lander?

You would have to give it a very high crash tolerance.

You would have to give it a very high crash tolerance.

Seriously, this is awesome. Do want.

When I'm playing with the parts, I keep thinking of H.G. Wells and the first Men in the Moon book and movie.

Do you think it might make for a fun lander?

You would have to give it a very high crash tolerance.

http://i.imgur.com/CvgP9IN.jpg

Its certainly a very kerbal-esque way to land on the mun
It could bounce on those pistons... Imagine the look on Jeb, Bill and Bob's faces as it bounces half way around the Mun...
Oh yea I have this film on DVD, very cool one :-) (first men on Moon)

ok, while I have been reducing poly count on my models and play testing, I have found that it is too easy to reach orbit with my steam rocket, anyone have any thoughts on this?

I was thinking of increasing weight, maybe dropping isp, or using more fuel to generate steam etc...

Also maybe a rework of the steam system to replace electricity, steam RCS, steam gyro's. generate steam by solar power (slowly)... Maybe fuel and nitrous oxide for burning in lamps?

anyway, back on topic, please drop some thoughts on the OP steam rocket

I would say that steam should be heavier. It's basically water. Or not the isp of rocket but propellant rate. The steam engine should probably also have a bit smaller power. (come on! A ROCKET engine has smaller power than steam?) Or... maybe make the generator heavier and less efficient?

I would say that steam should be heavier. It's basically water. Or not the isp of rocket but propellant rate. The steam engine should probably also have a bit smaller power. (come on! A ROCKET engine has smaller power than steam?) Or... maybe make the generator heavier and less efficient?

Good points, however I dont want to make it useless just balanced, i will probably combine a few nerfs to its component parts and see what happens

- - - Updated - - -

In other news, I was bored and started on the modular airship hull....
Still need to work on my baloons, But how is this?
Amazing! Too original!
O.o Awesome!

great "airship"

1. question ... if u use then ballons with HELIUM or HOTAIR ?

Huzzah, now we only need an ether propeller to propel us through the luminiferous aether and send us to Duna.

On the question of part balance, it is too easy to get into space right now, but I wouldn't worry about balancing them until you have the larger parts ready.

Edit: Are you basing your airship on Francesco Lana de Terzi?

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Francesco_Lana_de_Terzi

Edited April 15, 2014 by Tommygun
